meanings.sent1: The fog will obscurest the view of the mountains.
meanings.sent2: She used a thick curtain to obscurest the sunlight in the room.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to obscurest the disappearing act with smoke.
meanings.sent4: His emotions obscurest his true intentions like a dense fog.
meanings.sent5: The heavy rain will obscurest the road signs, making it hard to navigate.

meanings.definition: Not well known or easily understood.
meanings.sent1: The ancient language on the tablet was the obscurest thing I've ever seen.
meanings.sent2: The meaning of the poem was so obscurest that even the teacher was puzzled.
meanings.sent3: The cat's obscurest behavior of chasing its tail entertained the children.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were as obscurest as a cryptic riddle, impossible to decipher.
meanings.sent5: The obscurest book in the library held secrets waiting to be discovered.
